content: "{\"object\":\"value\",\"document\":{\"object\":\"document\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Invoicing workflow\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The terms of the contract should state the dates when invoices should be issued to the customer. As a rule invoices are issued by the end of the month for Time & Material contracts and at the completion of the project phase/deliverable for Fixed Fee contracts.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"NA and EU region: The Account Manager, Delivery/Project Manager or ASG (Account Support Group) can send preliminary billing data and reimbursable expenses breakdown to the customer for approval. Confirmation of amounts received from the customer is provided to revenue analyst.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Revenue analyst verifies billing data supplied by AM, DM/PM or ASG for invoicing against contract terms, project rates (using the project rate plan in UPSA whenever available) and approved billable travel and other expenses in CTC or can calculate billing data himself/herself, then communicates with AM, DM/PM or ASG to clarify any inconsistencies in case they appear.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Issued invoice and other supporting documentation stipulated in the contract are sent to the customer directly with a copy to the AM, DM/PM or ASG for passing to the customer. AM, DM/PM or ASG ensures that invoices are issued on all invoicing requests, that issued invoices agree with the respective applications and that they are mailed to the customer.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Invoicing process automated in EPAM CRM system is described below and based on invoice requests and invoices. Read more about \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"http://localhost:3000/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=308957278\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"creating invoice requests\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\".\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/49621bd2-08bb-406e-a3a1-8ed0818833bd/image2015-9-25%2012-8-8.png\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":482,\"height\":581}},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Time journals (Timesheets)\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"PMC\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Time journals must be locked once all employees have booked their time. Our process is to lock time journals at the end of each month, though DMs/PMs should review hours entered within their project on a weekly basis. Locking time journals should be completed within the first 3 days of the next month. If you do not lock your projects time journals, the admin team will lock it for you (and you will need to open a help desk ticket in order make any changes).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"On the month close, the Revenue Group ensures that all hours have been charged and does not pass to any invoicing or revenue accruals calculations until all time journals are completed to the appropriate extent (which means the discrepancies do not exceed the allowed threshold of 1.5% of the customer capacity). \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"To ensure that time journal entries cannot be changed after closing the reporting period (one month), time periods are also locked for billing. This is a higher-level lock compared to the lock for reporting that is executed by DM/PM. This type of lock secures that the time is invoiced and recorded in the correct accounting period and is consistent with reported time. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Key control activity: No one can alter reported hours after time journals were locked for billing. Alterations of reported hours on billable projects are possible only after time journals are reopened by revenue analysts upon approval from AM, DM/PM or ASG.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Monthly revenue recognition transactions are calculated by revenue analysts after all time journals have been locked for billing. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Billing\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Revenue on Time & Material contracts is recognized based on actual hours worked by employees and billing rates provided by the contract plus cost of billable material costs.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Using internal systems (UPSA, PMC) revenue analysts generate billing reports for the appropriate billing period for each active billable project. Data from these reports (billable hours and respective rates) is used for calculating the amount for revenue recognition. The hours are reconciled with PMC data; billing rates are reconciled with the contract terms.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If there is no project rate plan in UPSA revenue analysts generate billing reports manually using rates directly from the contract and hours from PMC and confirm it with AM, DM/PM or ASGby sending them billing reports via email. In case of no response from AM, DM/PM or ASG the approval from revenue analysts's resource manager should be obtained.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-2\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Revenue Collection\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Billing manager sends notifications (Account Receivable Report) to AM or customers with open invoices. AM is responsible to contact the customer in case of any payments delays and to provide comments to Revenue Group. Revenue Group can send reports and questions directly to the customer and cc the AM, but AM is the person of escalation for any issues.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\n\\n\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}}"
